TEXT: CARDINAL . The applicant , the commercial director of a private company ( “ the company ” ) , was suspected of fraud . On DATE a criminal case was instituted against him .

CARDINAL . ORG extended the term of the applicant ’s detention on remand twice : on DATE to CARDINAL DATE and on DATE to DATE . On DATE ORG extended the term of the applicant ’s detention on remand to DATE .

CARDINAL . The pre - trial investigation in the case was concluded on DATE . The applicant had access to the case - file from DATE , while the other CARDINAL co - accused were given access from DATE to DATE .
CARDINAL . In a communication of DATE , the prosecution informed the prison administration that the pre - trial investigation had been concluded and access to the case - file had commenced .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant applied to the prosecution for bail , contesting the lawfulness of his detention after DATE . On DATE a prosecutor informed the applicant that there were no reasons to vary the remand . The prosecutor stated inter alia , “ the access by the accused and their counsel to the case - file was completed on DATE . On DATE the criminal case was transmitted for the confirmation of the bill of indictment . The validity of the term of the applicant ’s detention was not breached ” . No remand decision was taken .

CARDINAL . CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant applied to ORG for bail . On DATE a judge of ORG committed the applicant to trial . In his decision the judge also decided that the applicant ’s “ remand shall remain unchanged ” . The decision did not refer to other aspects regarding the lawfulness of the applicant ’s detention . The judge also set DATE as the date of the first trial hearing .
CARDINAL . The hearing took place on DATE . On the same date the applicant again applied for bail .

CARDINAL . On DATE the judge of ORG , in the presence of the applicant ’s counsel , ordered further investigations in the case . The judge noted inter alia that the prosecution had alleged that financial damage to the company and its shareholders had been caused by the applicant and the co - accused . However , no victims had been established and questioned . In addition , the company ’s audit had not been properly carried out . The judge held that the trial could not continue until these procedural requirements were met .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant appealed to ORG , claiming that he had been unlawfully kept in detention after DATE . On DATE the applicant lodged with ORG a further appeal against the decisions of ORG of DATE and DATE . He stated inter alia that LAW had been breached to his detriment .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant submitted a complaint to the ORG , alleging that the term of his detention had expired on DATE , and that thereafter the prison administration had kept him in custody unlawfully .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG held an appeal hearing in the presence of the applicant ’s counsel . ORG dismissed the appeal insofar as it concerned “ the substance of the decision of ORG of DATE ” , pursuant to LAW as then in force . No aspects concerning the alleged unlawfulness of the applicant ’s detention were mentioned in the appellate decision . ORG nonetheless ordered the applicant ’s release on bail , without giving reasons . He was immediately released from prison .

CARDINAL . On DATE the ORG drew the attention of the Minister of ORG and the prison authorities to the fact that from DATE to CARDINAL DATE the applicant had been remanded in custody in breach of LAW ( c ) of the LAW .
CARDINAL . On DATE the additional investigation was concluded . On DATE the case was again transmitted to ORG . On DATE a judge of ORG committed the applicant to trial .

CARDINAL . On DATE the judge again decided to order further investigations . He noted that the investigating authorities had breached domestic criminal procedure in its conduct of the pre - trial investigation and the collection of additional evidence . CARDINAL . Upon the prosecution ’s appeal against the above decision , on DATE ORG quashed the decision of DATE . CARDINAL . On DATE a judge of ORG joined the case against the applicant and the CARDINAL co - accused with a case against another defendant . The judge withdrew from the case on the ground inter alia that he had taken decisions on the applicant ’s detention on DATE and DATE .
